inn1.comm: pushed off the legs to square
gone! Nipped off the pitch, a hint of swing, an outside edge and Dhoni does the rest.
stays over the wicket, but pitches wide trying to adjust for his first delivery to the right-hander - plenty of width and Bell simply leans into a Vaughanesque cover-drive
tighter delivery, pushed forward this time
defended on the front foot
vicious swing, doing all sorts as somehow Bell's uncertain prod fails to connect
driven to cover, Bell's nose up, trying to sniff a run; there wasn't one on
too much width outside off, and Bell cuts away off the back foot through cover
straighter, pushing Bell on to the back foot this time and he defends down
another tight delivery, defended well enough
opens the face, and sends a thick edge which drops just short of second slip
driven straight for a quick strike-stealing single
strays down leg and Bell helps it on his way with a flick off the hips
straight, threatening to rise up from a fuller delivery, defended back down
worked off his legs to short midwicket
shoulders arms, lets it go past him at chest height, outside off
that one seemed to have extra zip, and the swing was none-too-easy to deal with either - Bell offering his bat, away from his body, defensively and did well not to get an edge
more of the same - too good, too good
bangs it in too wide and too short, Prior waits, moves on to his back foot and crashes the ball in front of point with a wristy, quick movement
Agarkar tries to correct the line, but overdoes it, and Prior eases the ball off his legs just behind square

but he's on the button this time - very straight, Prior was a long way across his stumps when the ball rapped him. Now then, height could be a factor, and Hawk-Eye has it going over by an inch or so. Nevertheless, he's on his way
works off his legs and he's off the mark straight away
some tidy work from Uthappa in the covers, diving at full stretch to cut off a clip from Bell - and an enthusiastic crowd buzz at his efforts
defended on the back foot, Bell realising that he ought to be a little circumspect just now
...which is a dot, the ball climbing and Pietersen squaring into it, playing it back down without too much fuss in the end
Pietersen creeps across his stumps before clambering into a wall-like defence, getting his whole bat and his body right behind that one
an orthodox leave to a ball which jinks down off
pushed across him again, and once more Pietersen leaves outside off
on off, worked back towards leg, Pietersen happy, as usual, to take balls from outside off and work them square
fuller delivery, dug out with a sturdy defence - the batsmen consider for a split second a single, before realising that wouldn't be sensible
pushed up there, defended on the back foot with a delicate scoop - like ladling soup at an upper-class dinner party - back into the covers
this is more like KP - clipping one which comes in at him through midwicket - aggressive and with a good eye
angling in at him again, allowing him to whip that with a firm drive in front of midwicket. Quick hands, good stuff
a better line from Agarkar down the corridor; near enough to ask the question, but Pietersen answers with a well-judged leave on the back foot
slightly wider down off this time, curling away from him at the last minute, but easily left
swing in the air - both bowlers finding movement in these overcast conditions - but again it's wide enough not to prompt any interest
on leg, clipped with some superb timing through square
defended on the back foot
on off, worked away down to third man for an easy single (but an impossible two)
another quick single
defended into the covers
jumps over his bat, moved away from the right-hander
Powar slides to cut off the ball - surprisingly athletically
Bell cuts hard but the ball is well stopped
outside off, driven off the back foot into the covers, but again he can find no way through the pouncing ring
on off, driven back forward and it's picked up easily again
tight, angling in outside off, and that's a piece of exquisite judgement in leaving
worked to point off the back foot
on leg, a huge shout as he goes across Pietersen and raps him on the pads. It pitched outside leg, mind - a good decision by Peter "JR" Hartley
on middle-and-leg, driven back straightish on the on-side
an extravagant lunge of a leave outside off
straight and rising, worked back down off the back foot with a dink into the covers and a quick single results
angles across him before pitching on off, rising, and being worked out to gully off the back foot
came back in, and a big shout is turned down on height. Another good decision. Ah, and it pitched outside leg anyway
on off, driven out to mid-on, and picked up easily
very wide, cut wide in the air behind point and that raced away
driven off the back foot into the covers
on leg, driven in front of midwicket and that one goes all the way
on off, played off the back foot into the covers
outside off, played safely into the gully
on his pads, Pietersen shuffles to the off side before nudging it off his legs - straight to short midwicket, though
on the front foot, Pietersen turns it with good timing straight to mid-on, who is dozing, and they scamper an easy single
angled across the batsman who leaves it alone
again, a neat tempter which cuts across Bell but he leaves this alone
a confident punch out to cover, and Robin Uthappa dives to his right to prevent more than one
angled to gully
ooh nasty, Pietersen's struck in the unmentionables. Ouch. He seems to find it quite amusing though
drifting down the leg side, Pietersen helps it on its way for a single
again the wrong line from Ganguly, drifting down leg and it's easily worked for another single
a beauty! Ganguly finally corrects his line - and it holds its line outside off, drawing Pietersen into a defensive poke...and he misses
whipped to midwicket from outside the off stump, but no run is on offer there
and that's a good end to the over, almost squaring Pietersen up here but he punches it back to the bowler

inside edge for four! Another belting delivery from Zaheer, cutting this back into Bell who rocks back to defend but gets a thick inside edge - thick enough to evade Dhoni's dive to his left, and it races away for four
wide, well wide of the off stump

that is a fantastic stroke from Bell. Certainly not a half volley from Zaheer - in fact, it was very well bowled, pitching it up on off stump. But Bell threw his hands at it, opened the blade and it shot through the covers for four. Class
punched to cover. Bell roars no
elegantly punched to a deep mid-off and Bell takes a single who throws down the stumps...but he took an age to wind himself up and let go of the ball
wide, down the leg side. Very wide and rightly wided
again down the leg side - time Zaheer had a rest I reckon - and flicked to Powar at fine-leg. And Pietersen comes back for two, quite easily too
Bell takes this from outside the off stump, and turns it to a short fine-leg. Excellent running
a touch too straight again, and it wobbles off his pads for an easily run leg-bye
so close! Wide of the off stump but it spears back into Bell, who is back in his crease and trying to cut...and it practically shaves his off stump
on his legs but Pietersen can't get this away
punched back to the bowler; Ganguly just gets a fingertip on it, deflecting it onto the non-striker's stumps
Pietersen tries to clump this into the covers but can only splodge it back to the bowler. Excellent length again from Ganguly
what a ball, on leg stump and turning away off his pads
on leg stump again and Bell pushes it back to him
but a poor delivery here - a waste - outside Bell's leg stump and he clips it freely and elegantly over midwicket for four
yet again down the leg side, and Bell can't get a bat on it
tossed up on leg stump. Bell tries to clip it to leg but can't time it
on middle stump for the first time this over, and Bell comes forward to defend
a very firm punch to cover. Pietersen wants a single - this could be a disaster, but they scrape home
good line and length outside Bell's off stump and he angles it defensively to the off side
beautifully played - the balance and feet movement were key here. Too short, Bell was very quick to rock back onto his stumps and he cuts it powerfully in front of square for four
stroked down the ground but the deep mid-off dives to prevent two
down the leg side, Pietersen clips it off his toes but straight to the man at deep square leg
excellent stop from Powar moving to his left at mid-off
on middle stump, Pietersen comes forward to defend. It bobbles out to midwicket and they scamper through for a single
on middle-and-off, well flighted and it's defended
beautifully flighted again and Bell rather loosely  tries to defend and gets a thick inside edge which nearly takes out his leg stump
punched out to cover
he's bowled him! The topper from Piyush and Bell is completely outfoxed. Down on one knee, he tries to smash him over the top but is clean bowled
a waste of a delivery down the leg side
stroked out to cover; Powar, as quick as a (rather large) cat scampers across to field
neatly stroked straight back past the bowler, though without really timing it

punched out to cover, and they go for a single - this could be a disaster. In comes the throw, Dhoni whips off the bails but the umpires haven't called for a replay. But hold on - drama here - Collingwood, according to the big screen replay, is short of his ground! And after a bit of a delay, and a referral to the TV umpire, Collingwood's given his marching orders by the umpire
beautiful shot, stroked through extra cover for four. Not a bad way in which to get off the mark
short of a length, Shah extravagantly leaves this alone
very wide and Shah again leaves alone
Pietersen takes a big stride down the pitch and pokes it out to off
nicely flighted on middle-and-off, Pietersen chips it back to Piyush
worked into midwicket
a touch too short, it's hammered out to cover and a fumble allows them through for a single. A safe single...
well bowled, but well left! Shah leaves it alone outside off. This could be a fantastic battle
defended out to cover
a good length from Ganguly, preventing Pietersen from timing it sufficiently. It's clumped to mid-on
down the leg side, Pietersen simply whips it for four. Easy. And made all the more easy since the fine-leg is up
turned off his legs to midwicket who is deep enough to allow them through for an easily run single
worked to leg
a dab down to third man for an easy single
ooh well bowled! He plays and misses outside off to a nice little swinger
tossed up outside off stump, quite wide but not called
comes forward, again not much turn for Chawla and an inside edge runs backward of square on the leg side
outside off stump, left alone
drifts onto middle and Pietersen goes down and brings out a fine lap-sweep, the ball runs towards the fine-leg boundary, but Powar sprints around (honest) and pulls off a fine diving save
Shah's attempt at a sweep is more violent, but he doesn't make contact
plays this one finer, behind square on the leg side
another handsome, bottom-handed drive past mid-off, no chance for the fielder (it was Powar again) but even a better fielder wouldn't have stopped that
down the leg side, sharp take from Dhoni and Shah does well to keep his foot behind the line
on off stump, Shah comes forward and defends by his feet
tucked into the leg side, midwicket can't prevent a single
played very late by Pietersen, bounces from the pitch into Dhoni's glove
Ganguly continues to cause problems with his nibbling leg-cutters, outside off stump and Pietersen pokes at it without making contact
driven down to long on, Pietersen keeps the strike
tossed up on off stump, driven to short extra-cover
hint of turn this time, Pietersen judges well and lets it go
comes forward, bat and pad together
Chawla tempts Pietersen into a drive, goes powerfully on the bounce to cover
googly, but too wide of off stump and Pietersen can still leave alone
another testing over from Chawla, a maiden as Pietersen defends to the leg side
Shah comes carefully forward and defends to the man under the helmet
taken off middle with a fine sweep, deep backward square-leg runs round to field
teasing flight from Powar, Pietersen comes forward
uses his feet on this occasion, worked into the leg side and there's time for a quick single to midwicket
watchfully defended, Shah not trying anything too expansive at the moment
brings out another sweep, short fine-leg is in and prevents any runs...tidy start from Powar
dragged a touch short, Pietersen latches on and cuts out towards deep point, Ganguly comes around and has to get his trousers dirty with a dive
flamboyant drive, but it just brings a single down to long off
tight line, Shah defends into the leg side
tries to sweep from outside off stump, doesn't make contact and there's a strangled shout from Dhoni but it's quickly aborted
slightly straighter and Shah's sweep makes contact to bring him one to deep square-leg
worked against the spin down to long-on
ah, guess what, another sweep, deep square-leg a busy man
squirted off the face, square on the off side and splits the men at cover and backward point
beautifully bowled, straighter ball from Powar and Shah is beaten as he tries to work to leg
reverts to his release shot of the sweep, but finds short fine-leg
punched with a straight bat towards mid-on, who is in the circle, and a direct hit would have found Shah short...England can't afford that
swept off the stumps, can't beat the man at 45
googly from Chawla, Shah has to jab down quite late on it and plays into the leg side
not a particularly elegant sweep, goes in front of square and brings Pietersen back onto strike
stifled appeal as Pietersen makes sure he is well outside the line of off stump as he sweeps, but England not finding the spinners easy
and on cue Pietersen is beaten by a legbreak outside off stump
scooped off the front foot, wide of short fine-leg, as Will tries to explain to me with a waft of his hand
touch shorter, punched into the covers
outside off stump, uses his feet and defends

well, well, Pietersen trying something very different, he brings out a reverse-hit. He sets himself almost before Powar has let the ball go, but for all the effort the ball trickles into the off side, before a misfield allows a second
nearly a leading edge, but safe enough in the end
worked off the pads through square leg
softly defended under his eyes
nudged into the leg side, the spinners racing through the overs. Good tactics from India
starts round the wicket and with a slip, Pietersen comes forward and defends
worked from off stump into the leg side, easy single
defended by Shah, will England try and attack Yuvraj?
uses his wrists and places this into the gap at midwicket, rotates the strike
another missed sweep from Pietersen, but again gets well outside off stump so no danger
Pietersen moves across the stumps, flicks through square leg to the man on the boundary
waits and plays off the back foot with the turn, and notices the chance for a quick two
floaty (46mph) on off stump, Pietersen flicks to short fine-leg
straighter ball, Pietersen picks it late and can't find a gap
dragged in short, he was onto that in a flash, and hammered away to the deep midwicket boundary. Welcome boundary for England
can't beat the infield on the leg side, quicker ball from Powar
placed into the off side, easy single and Pietersen gets his first ODI fifty of the season off 80 balls, vital innings
knocked to square and some sprinting ensues

horrible cricket - Pietersen flaps at a wide ball but doesn't quite get hold of it. He turns for two, but Shah remains rooted to his crease and although Pietersen is stranded nine-tenths of the way towards the other end. An almighty mix-up, but a tidy enough throw
defended on the front foot
left alone outside off, patient
reaches out to drive to cover
a nervy start indeed, flashing a cut, but it's too close to his body and he wafts under it
driven forward for a quick single
tame drive towards mid-on now
waits and clamps right down on the ball
plenty of loop, tempting Wright, but he defends at the last minute. The better option
a touch fo width outside and there was nearly another run-out there as Shah had to dive back in at the non-striker's end - a direct shy and he would have been a goner
scoops at the ball as it turns from him
big spin away from the batsman
quick hands guide the ball to gully
waits, waits... and defends on the back foot
waits again, there's a touch of room and he plays an easy, strong lateish cut behind point
dragged a touch short on off and Wright waits before confidently planting up and over midwicket
wider outside off, and eased through the covers
plants one foot down and drives to mid-on, eager for a single that's not on, so Shah will be back on strike
the batsman negotiates the turn to work the ball out on the off-side... Wright losing his footing and stumbling on his way, but very safe
swept well to midwicket, getting right over the ball and controlling it well
worked to midwicket for a quick single
on middle, whipped off the legs behind square for a quick single
gosh, great ball - outside off, turning right back in quickly and Wright somehow keeps it out
uses his feet to the spin and drives to mid-on
outside off, slight turn away, Wright tries to make room to cut to point
worked to cover for a quick single
reaches out - almost overreaches - to drive to cover
driven out to long-off for an easy single
on off-and-middle, a half-shout as the ball pops up off the pad. But it was outside the line
excitement there, as the ball veers up and through - but it rushed up off the pad
on off but worked out to midwicket for a soft single
on middle, bobbling up off the pad
outside off and swept round behind square for an easy run
left alone outside off
worked behind square where it's picked up easily
confused by a slightly straighter one, but gets away with it
over the ball, defended forward
angling down leg, worked out easily to mid-on
outside off, wideish, cut down well through third man, using the pace of the ball
on off, driven uppishly - but safe - to long-off
on off-and-middle, Shah is over that one and kills it
googly, but dealt with and there's some tidy running for a second
down the track, wristed from off wide of mid-on
on off, worked to midwicket
on leg, paddled to just behind square
outside off, punched squareish - just in front of point
loop again, Shah gets over it and controls it well off the front foot to square
down the ground and hit hard past mid-on, a four to end the over
makes room to cut hard through cover and that was travelling indeed
beaten by one which pitches on middle and zips away down off - neat delivery
on leg, worked out in front of square, Dhoni in hot pursuit
width and cut away through point: another well-struck shot
another flashing shot - this time an excellent cover drive, and the placement so good, too
worked into the covers this time
outside off and edged away to third man
banged in short and pulled away - lots of space for him there
width outside off, Wright flashes a cut and misses out - and he's annoyed with himself, too
a thick edge flashed up (and inevitably down) to Tendulkar behind point
on the money this time, but nibbled down to gully off the back foot
outside off and driven to cover
tossed up outside the off stump, Shah goes for an expansive (and overly ambitious) sweep. Dhoni collects and attempts a stumping, but it's not out
another sweep, and this time it bobbles off his pads. Well flighted
down the leg side, Shah tries to scoop this over fine leg but misses it...and Dhoni roars an appeal for a catch.
much better. A skip down the pitch and he hammers it down the ground
pushed to mid-on
a huge hit, but he hasn't got all of this...though he's timed it well enough for it to sail over deep midwicket, and it falls inches short of the boundary rope
cheeky! Impish shot from Shah, flicking this down to fine-leg; a paddle-cum-sweep for four
another paddle but just for a single as fine-leg is deep and comes across to field
driven on the up with a flourishing flow of the bat. Powar lands heavily to prevent four
shot! Superb stroke. A full toss, and Shah dispatches him over long-off for six
down the leg side, this could be four more as Shah clunks it through midwicket but it's well fielded out on the deep mid-wicket boundary
slightly ugly stroke from Shah, sweeping this and top-edging it over short midwicket. It lands safely, but could have so easily looped into deep midwicket's hands
well bowled. He angles this across Shah who plays and misses
and again. Shah tries to pull this but the ball seems to keep a little low
well bowled! Full and straight, Shah tries to block this out...and misses
the slower ball, it's nudged back to the bowler
another excellent delivery, yorker length on off stump but Shah digs it out and at last breaks the shackles with a single to point
Wright takes a step down the pitch and tries to moose him over cover, but can only pat it out meekly to the off side.
slower ball, outside the off stump and he punches this out to cover to bring up his maiden fifty
an ugly full toss which Shah tries to dispatch into the deep midwicket boundary, but can only spoon it for a couple to the leg side
clunked out to cover, played with one hand off the bat
what a remarkable stroke. A low full toss, which is never easy to pick up - but Shah does just that, punching it over the bowler's head for four. And what timing
outside the off stump, Shah simply swings it over midwicket for six. Pure timing, and innocuous bowling
patted out to point
full and straight, as you'd expect, and he can only nudge it out to cover
punched to mid-on and Wright sets off for a single, but he's timed it very well and mid-on throws down the stumps. The third umpire is called for, and Wright is a few inches short of his ground
angled out to cover for a single
paddled around the corner and, despite some rather lethargic fielding, they opt not to go for two
full, straight and defended
clipped to mid-on and again the stumps are thrown down but Mascarenhas is safely home
a full toss, Mascarenhas forces it to long-off without really timing it sufficiently
marvellous stroke from Shah - pure class here. A slower ball which he paddles over midwicket, evading deep midwicket, and he picks up four
brilliant batting. Absolutely superb stroke. Yet another full toss, but Shah picks it up with a short-arm flick over midwicket - very nearly for six. He is ticking, now
patted down to point for a quick single
yorker length, he jabs down on it and squirts it out to cover
flicked to midwicket, and they scamper for a single. No, in fact they've gone for two - and they get it comfortably
a nasty bouncer, though Mascarenhas plays it well and dabs it out to cover
again short of a length, Mascarenhas gets behind it to nudge it out to cover
edged! Or did he play that intentionally? Either way it flies down to third man. Replays show he probably did play it intentionally
another deft piece of batting, almost a squirt down to third man and an excellent piece of fielding saves four
he tries to dab this down to third man again but Dhoni prevents the single
excellent end to a fine 10-over spell from Zaheer, as Shah plays and misses outside off
fired into the leg stump, it's squirted out to cover and they scamper through to get Shah back on strike
down the leg side, well wide and rightly wided
neatly turned off his hip to leg
short of a length, Mascarenhas goes back and short-arm-pulls it to long-on but without timing
again wide of the leg stump. Again it's wided
swept with one hand, top-edged and short fine-leg can't cling on. Difficult chance
on off stump this time, Shah goes for an expansive sweep over midwicket but misses
yet another wide down the leg side. He's not really learning, is he?
smacked down the ground but only for a single
full, straight and hammered down the ground for Shah's hundred! A fabulous innings, from 91 balls - rescuing England from a perilous state. Well played
punched back to Tendulkar
cut in front of square for two. Well placed
brilliant batting, but poor bowling. It was right in Shah's slot, outside his off stump and a nice-and-juicy length. He just swings it over long-on for four
quicker ball which he clumps to midwicket
cut out to cover for a single
an ugly and not particularly effective mow

and he swings this over midwicket, high and handsome - but Piyush is lurking, and makes excellent ground to take a brilliant catch. However...such was his velocity that he slid into the boundary, and it's six! Tough luck.
he takes a step outside leg and smites him for six into the midwicket fence! Bosh!
and another one! This is marvellous batting here. Another step outside leg; another six into midwicket
he's done it again! And this has gone even further into the midwicket boundary. A brilliant, crisp, effortless clip for six
make that five sixes in the over! And the biggest of the lot, straight back over the bowler's head! Quite breathless cricket

inn2.comm: starts well, on off stump and defended back to the bowler
leans into an elegant drive, straight down the ground and the outfield is quick. But James Anderson chases it down well and saves two on the boundary
well bowled, back of a length and jags back into Ganguly, beating him on the inside edge...good carry, too
goes for a cut, but gets a bottom edge into the ground and it bobbles square on the off side
on middle and off, Ganguly stays on the crease and defends towards midwicket
clipped of his hips, past square leg and nicely timed, but Panesar runs round from long leg and keeps them to two
draws an outside edge first ball, but it flies safely wide of second slip and down to third man
strays down the leg side and an easy call for Peter Hartley
taken fine off the hip, not enough pace to reach the boundary and Jon Lewis, on as sub for Shah, does the fielding
turned off his body, down to long leg who this time is Broad
finds the gap between cover and point, a strong area for Ganguly, and it races away over the net areas for the first boundary
plays off the back foot, behind square on the leg side
drifting a little too straight and that's easy pickings for Tendulkar through square leg, Broad brings off a fine save on the boundary along with some good teamwork with Luke Wright
goes for a drive, the ball takes an inside edge and he was fortunate not to drag into his stumps
good line and length on off stump, draws Ganguly forward but it's a controlled edge down to third man
lovely shot, too straight again from Broad and it's effortlessly flicked through the vacant square leg...India in the mood for a big chase
good comeback, on a probing line outside off stump and Tendulkar makes a late decision to let it go
outside off stump, no hint of movement, and Tendulkar is happy to leave it alone
on the stumps and Tendulkar eases it past mid-on, not quite enough power to reach the boundary but Tendulkar is ticking early
played from the crease up to mid-on
good pace from Anderson, 86mph, and Ganguly defends into the off side
fuller from Anderson, searching for a hint of swing, and driven towards mid-off
slower ball, Ganguly waits for it and turns into the leg side, but can't beat Wright at midwicket
offers Ganguly a hint of width, but he doesn't time his drive and it rolls slowly into the covers
ends a good over outside off stump, Tendulkar lets it pass
turned straight to midwicket, Ganguly not quite finding the gaps at the moment
outside off stump and Ganguly leans into a drive, but again not with much timing and it's just a single into the covers, but it brings Tendulkar back onto strike
first short ball of the innings, nearly 88mph, and Tendulkar drops his hands and sways comfortably out of the way
forced off the back foot, Ian Bell does the work in the covers
another bouncer, this one is shorter and goes over Tendulkar's head...there weren't many short balls from the Indian quick bowlers
defended into the leg side, nearly a collision between batsmen as they take a single
loses his line down the leg side, takes a little piece of bat and shoots away past Matt Prior for a boundary
flicked squarer on the leg side, down to Broad at long leg, Anderson needs to get back on off stump
handsome drive from Ganguly, wide half volley from Anderson and Ganguly frees his arms through the line and sends it racing to the extra cover boundary
angled backward of point, third man is very square and keeps them to a single
better bowling, brings a defensive push from Tendulkar who races off for a single, Ganguly eventually responds and it's an easy run
outside off stump, well timed again from Ganguly but this time goes straight to cover
back of a length from Broad, bounces at Tendulkar who defends with a high bat down into the pitch
hint of width, but Tendulkar's cut goes straight to backward point
long half volley and powerfully driven towards mid-off, Anderson does well to get a hand on it and saves a boundary...Broad was annoyed with that delivery
punched off the back foot to the man at short point, a position England have used throughout the series
good bouncer, going over middle and off, Ganguly thought about having a hook but decided very late not to bother
tidy finish from Broad, Ganguly defends back down the pitch
top shot, overpitched from Anderson and Tendulkar brings out a perfect off drive, no chance for mid-off this time
another lovely shot from Tendulkar, a length delivery and a strong flick of the wrists sends it racing through the leg side for back-to-back boundaries
make that three in a row, almost identical from bowler and batsmen, Anderson is too straight and Tendulkar is too good
goes fuller, aiming for a yorker, and Tendulkar defends up to mid-on
the other extreme this time, a bouncer, and Tendulkar comfortably sways clear of the ball
quick single to mid-on, well run and Tendulkar keeps the strike
drives towards mid-on again, but too quickly for a run on this occasion
dangerous line from Broad, straight at Tendulkar, but the whip goes straight to square leg
forced off the back foot, beats short extra-cover and Panesar is on the edge of the circle at mid-off so it's an easy single
backs away to the leg side and launches a good length ball over extra-cover, Ganguly is off now and in typical style
pushed up to mid-off, but Ganguly doesn't really do quick singles and stays put
tries to give himself room again, but Broad stays tight to the body and can only find extra cover
punched to short extra-cover
down the leg side, Prior does well to get a glove on it
driven uppishly past short extra-cover, and mid-off does the fielding
defended to backward point, how long will he resist the medium-pace?
watchfully played to extra cover
good stuff from Mascarenhas, Ganguly can't him through the off side
driven from Ganguly, but straight at square cover
a touch short, Tendulkar caresses an easy drive to cover
stays over the wicket, not too much wrong with that but Ganguly opens his shoulders and drives that straight towards the pavilion for six - just over the boards. Creamed
on leg this time, Ganguly nudges to Cook in short on the leg-side and there was indecision for a moment
outside leg, swirled round behind square
worked to leg
stroked to mid-off where he pinches a single - and the strike to boot
half a shout for one which pitches outside, and then angles in
straightish again and driven out to mid-on
on off again and finally the attempt comes off - a nice, cheeky paddle steer, using the pace really, and that runs away through fine leg
plays on the rise, driving back to the covers where there's a good stop by Bell
worked to gully
great diving stop by Collingwood in the gully and Ganguly is furious that the ball was cut off in its prime
slow offcutter, aiming towards middle, Tendulkar gives himself room to try to cut off the back foot, but hasn't quite got the space
not timed properly to the gully, the ball crashing into the ground off the back-foot cut
slower ball, at 65mph, straight and dragged down - Tendulkar not missing out on the pull shot there

slower ball again and Tendulkar looks to almost stop on the shot - but in fact he was in total control, hitting through the line over mid-on, not even needing a full swing of the bat as he lobs the fielder
brings up his fifty with an edge through third man past the man diving in short
settles for the single this time with an easy shot - and maintains the strike
now that's a massive six - straight through the line again, with a lovely clean hit straight and all the way to bring up his first six this innings
incredible. Terrific shot, stepping back and allowing enough room for a back-foot drive through cover
kicking himself there, after missing out on an attempted cut - nearly teasing through an edge
leg-side rubbish from Mascarenhas and Tendulkar doesn't need a second invitation to punish that through fine leg ... even if it was off his pads
straight delivery, up there, and Tendulkar drives back easily for a single to long-on
a steer to mid-off to bring up India's hundred and retain the strike
a dot, I can confirm that. Eased into the covers
stepping down and swinging that one with a lift over mid-off
driven to cover and picked up tidily
swivel pulled, standing tall and delivering right over square
dropped down for a quick single into the covers
cut to point - missed out on that, really, but they won't mind
turns right back into the left-hander out of the rough - and a lesser-spotted dot leaps onto the ball-by-ball
delicious late steer, flat, behind point and that eludes Broad's dive
a tame dot
cuts late at that - not enough room to do what he wanted
eased off his legs to square
on leg, turned away in front of square
on the money, scrooged back to the bowler
dragged that one down, and pulled, fairly ungainly-ly as it were, in front of square
cute, very cute. Tendulkar down on one knee and sweeps so sweetly through fine leg, eluding Panesar once more
huge, though lone, shout from Prior behind the sticks for one which pitched straight enough but was going way down leg. There was possibly a touch of bat first up, too
defended on the back foot
angled across the left hander, who cuts hard but only as far as gully
a solid defence this time
more of the same - defence
enough room on leg to work to short midwicket for a quick single
outside off, tries to work that down to third man, but is a touch too late on the shot
on off, worked behind square for a naughty single. That's Ganguly's 1000th ODI run in 2007, apparently, so well done him - averaging more than 55, too, no mean feat
tries to pull but is deceived by the turn away just outside off - and Panesar's hands fly to his head
it's raining runs, hallelujah. This time it's Ganguly who steps back to give himself room to effect a kind-of baseball smash straight over mid-off
worked to short cover this time
on middle and Ganguly offers a premeditated paddle of a dink behind square to take him ever closer to his fifty
comes forward to make the delivery into a half-volley, which he drives to cover
slower delivery, Ganguly adjusts and drives to long-off for his 71st ODI fifty, his 11th this year. This came at a strike rate of 90.7
pushed right up there and driven to the covers
driven back to Panesar, who crouches into a long barrier
backs away to then lean out and drive powerfully through cover
on middle, driven to the covers and it's tidied up quickly
on leg, a press of a defensive works the ball into the leg-side and it's soon picked up by a swooping fielder
on leg, delivered fairly flat, and Tendulkar negates the spin
on middle-and-leg now, a touch shorter, allowing Tendulkar to work the ball off his legs to square
pinged to cover with pleasant timing, but the man at cover fields it neatly
half a shout from Broad as Tendulkar walks across his stumps, but he's hit well outside the line. A splendid and facile decision from the umpire
Tendulkar tries to pull, and almost dragged his bat in a full circle...the ball wobbling off the toe-end of his bat
well bowled. Short of a length forcing him onto the back foot, and Tendulkar defends with a straight blade
short, wide and cut for four. Excellent timing, Tendulkar rocking back and placing it perfectly
driven to mid-off
nudged to leg, but there's no run on offer for Ganguly
ooh, he's down the pitch and skews it over extra cover for two
steps to leg this time and cuts it hard out to cover
rubbish delivery. Wide, short and smacked - absolutely laced off the back foot through extra cover. Terrible ball. Next.
much better delivery on middle-and-off, forcing Tendulkar to defend
on leg stump, he tries to work it through midwicket but his timing eludes him
well bowled, a good yorker which Ganguly digs out...before hurriedly rushing back into his crease as the backspin of the ball threatened to wobble onto his stumps
got him! A breakthrough for England at last as Ganguly tries to lift Broad over the infield but can only slap it straight to Pietersen at cover
short, punched to point
back of a length, he defends with a straight bat to leg
Broad pitches it up this time, and it's firmly defended on the front foot
defended on the front foot
driven square of the wicket, but no run on offer
what a stroke that is. Well flighted from Monty, Tendulkar drives on the up through extra cover. Perfect placement, and the timing was spot on
on his legs, Tendulkar attempts to nurdle this but can't time it
stroked on the up - and a little uppishly, too - to cover
worked off his pads to mid-on
Tendulkar nearly, so nearly spoons this to mid-off. Another uppishly driven shot
nudged back to the bowler
a nice length here, on off stump, and it's punched out to cover
sweetly stroked out to cover but without timing
swinging into his off stump, a tight line and it's blocked out
pushed to cover, where there was probably a single on offer...but Tendulkar is practically incapacitated out there
turned around the corner for a single, and Tendulkar reluctantly hobbles through
he skips down the pitch and chips this to mid-on
turned to leg
again he skips down the pitch but cant break the infield on the leg side
and he misses this altogether, as he tries to work it round the corner but it bobbles off his pads
and a single at last, punched down the ground

got him! Brilliant catch from Collingwood. Tendulkar stepped outside leg and tried to loft Monty over mid-off, but he didn't get any elevation in the stroke. Collingwood, lurking at mid-off, got both hands to it and pouched a very low, excellent catch
outside his leg stump, it's neatly taken by Prior
poked out to cover off the front foot
magnificent stroke. A firm front foot is planted down the pitch and he strokes this one over Collingwood's head for four
poor line. On his legs, he simply works it through midwicket
stroked out to cover, though without proper timing
driven down the ground to long-off
pushed to leg
he comes dancing down the pitch like a champion, but can't loft this as well he'd like. It bobbles out to mid-on
well bowled, tossing this up outside his off stump. It's defended with due caution
lovely shot; very firmly swept indeed, crisply struck but straight to deep midwicket
that's a fine, fine blow. Dancing down the pitch, negating what little spin Monty is extracting, and he smacks Monty over his head for six
so close! Both batsman and wicketkeeper are beaten (as are the stumps), the ball somehow evading all three. Excellent ball spitting venomously back into the left-hander
angled off the face of the bat to a short third man
well bowled, Collingwood. Full and straight and the batsman can only nudge it back to him
a bit of loop-and-flight from Collingwood there, a slower ball but it's well picked by the batsman - dropping this out to cover and they scamper through with urgency
worked through midwicket for a couple
driven out to long-off
on his legs, it's punched to midwicket but just for a single this time
worked to leg
poor, wasteful delivery. Short, fast and wide, Yuvraj pulls it with greedy power over long-on
turned around the corner for a single. Actually, no they're coming back for two - and Anderson's got a good arm, but not the best of radars this time
pushed back to the bowler
firmly defended on the front foot
turned to the exocet-armed Collingwood at short midwicket. Thus, no run.
angled into the covers, comfortably single for two quick runners
pushed back to Collingwood, who is in off-cutter mode
lovely flowing drive, frees his arms through the covers and there's two out to long-off
tucked off the legs, backward of square on the leg side
easily driven up to long off, keeps the singles coming...that's what India need to do for the next few overs
inside edge into the pad, bobbles into the leg side and Yuvraj keeps the strike
starts with a very wide delivery, barely pitched on the cut strip
follows up with a long hop, but it's pulled straight to short fine-leg
tossed up fuller, driven to short extra-cover
goes for a cut and misses, close call
short again, cut away through point
big full toss, eased up to long-on
another huge wide outside off, what a mixed-bag from Shah
ends with a dot, very full and driven at extra cover
pushed into the off side, backward point does the work
over pitched and driven through the covers, long-off has to run round and Anderson can't collect cleanly, it was two anyway
superb shot, lofted over mid-on with a straight bat as he picks his spot to perfection
tucked off the hip into the huge space at square leg
nearly for England, leading edge from Yuvraj and it loops tantalisingly past Collingwood
played into the covers off the front foot but no chance of a run
very full, almost a yorker, and dug out down to long-off
opens the face and drives towards backward point
gently placed into the covers, easy rotation by these two
turned to midwicket, Bell can't stop the single
dug out to midwicket, good work from Bell stops a run
brilliant work from Collingwood at cover as Yuvraj connects with a powerful drive, but the England captains completes a superb save
guided down to third man with an open face

there's the breakthrough, and what a wicket for England. The ball stops on the pitch and Yuvraj can only pop a return catch back to Mascarenhas, who reacts well in his follow through. He looked fairly startled by that catch, but a vital moment in the game
taken off middle out to deep square-leg as Dravid gets going off his first ball
comes forward and defends back down the pitch
glided down to third man
uses his wrists to open the face, another single to third man
drives with an open face out to deep cover
similar shot from Gambhir, another easy single into the covers
on leg stump, whipped out to deep square-leg
short but Shah gets away with it, just a single out to backward point

another huge wicket! And what scalp to get for your first international wicket. Dravid gets a leading edge as he tries to through the leg side and Collingwood takes a fine, low catch diving forward from midwicket....it would have been a wide, down the leg side, if Dravid had left it, but what a day Shah is having
tucks his first ball to short fine-leg, doesn't risk a single to Panesar
wide from Mascarenhas, Gambhir goes after it but misses his cut...nearly a wide, but not quite
neatly tucked off his hip into the leg side
nicely bowled, hint of shape and pushed square on the off side
flashy play and miss from Dhoni, tension building all-round, what a finish we could have
lunges forward and pushed straight to cover
driven down to long off, but another good over for England
turned to midwicket, they scamper for an easy single
yorker dug out into the leg side
top shot to relieve the pressure, uses his feet and goes inside out over extra cover and finds the boundary
low full toss turned out to deep midwicket
punched down to long on
driven square through cover, in the air for a while but safe enough for a couple out to Broad on the cover boundary
pushed fairly straight on the off side, they think of a single but it Mascarenhas does the fielding in his follow through...nearly a mix-up
squirted to backward point
another firm drive from Dhoni, but can't beat extra cover as the pressure grows again
again, a vital dot ball, as a flat-batted drive finds Pietersen in the ring
Dhoni still can't find the gap at cover
driven firmly back to Panesar
flicked down to long on, when will the Indians have a dart?
lunges forward, all Dhoni can do is defend
fired in very full, just a single up to long off, that's fine for England
uses his feet, goes straight down the ground but not with his earlier timing and it goes two bounces to long on
lofted out, one bounce, to deep midwicket
not quite out of the middle of the bat, but enough to find deep midwicket

Panesar takes the catch! Huge skier to long-on and Gambhir, giving himself room, backs away but holes out just short of what would have been a fine half-century. Panesar watched that all the way and pointed his finger in the air in serious salute
driven off the back foot to cover
nibbled forward
defended on the front foot
driven straight forward
comes forward and splays a thick edge to point - the ball going nowhere near where it was going, to paraphrase Richie
defended on the front foot, crept right over to kill the bounce
driven on the front foot to midwicket
wide down leg, and paddled round through fine
pressed forward in defence, the ball rolling towards point
dragged short, flapped a thickish outside edge through third man
defended on the front foot
"Get on it, get on it," squawks Prior, imploring someone to "Get on it" over in front of midwicket
outside off, cut in front of point
on off, dragged down a touch, driven out to mid-on
strayed down leg and helped well on its way - ah, it seemed - in fact it's wides
full, slow, but squeezed out to mid-off
pretty much on the money, and Mascarenhas is quick to run round to cut the ball off with his left hand
short, pulled away and easily finds the yawning gap near the non-existent cow
off-cutter, pulled away but not cleanly, into the leg-side for one
slowish again, nearly deceives the batsman, who pops up into space
on the money, driven out to cover
slower again, driven out to long-off for a safe single
loopy yorker, good delivery to finish, results in a dot
good pace and right up there, Dhoni drives into his toes and the ball runs on to cover
full again, and more swing, and driven into the ground - out to cover again
zoomed in on his toes, in line with leg, dug out well - but a dot won't do so well at this stage
same again, really good delivery from Anderson, on middle and driven out to mid-on
down the track, wideish, a flap results in the ball running down to deep third man where Mascarenhas tidies up
full again, middle, driven down the ground for what should have just been a single but Pietersen fluffs that (and that's putting it kindly) and the ball runs for four
slower, wide, and crouchingly cut down into the third man, clever
up there, on off, tries to work it to leg but Prior's cries of, yes, you guessed "Get on it" go answered - no run
horrible full toss is treated to a spank behind square
outside off, slammed into his foot - perhaps not quite where he wanted to place that
a quick single rushed forward and well taken
good yorker, and a tidy slide at mid-off to keep them to one
short of a length and some quality commitment from Mascarenhas on the cover boundary - really went to an effort to cut that one off
walked down the track and was lucky to get away with a hard flash which ran away fine through the long-ago-vacated first slip area - Prior should have got something on that, all the same
hopeful appeal for lbw, the batsman well outside the line of off - bit of an ungainly defence, though, with Bambi-like splayed legs agogo
more orthodox this time, a sweep to bring up the fifty partnership and there's an overthrow to boot

what an extraordinary shot that was - and nearly a six. Dhonie goes down on one knee to meet a full toss and he straight sweeps it right behind him and it pings away like a flat golf shot. Most unusual
swings a single to mid-off
full toss - deliberate? - gets away with it, anyway, as Dhoni can only pick out long-on on the bounce
good bowling, ugly shot - Broad zooming over the sticks, as Uthappa walks way outside his off stump to try the hoick to leg - but connects with nothing
decent ball, up there, results in a drive to long-off
full again, and driven out to the man at long-on, again on the bounce
full toss once more - Broad favouring the fuller length - and pulled out straight towards long-on, where it's cut off once more
bowled him - Dhoni shuffling over to off to try to sweep it round, but the ball nutmegged him and appeared to get a thin bobble off the inside of his left pad - I'll confirm after replays
down the track, huge outside edge, runs all the way
on leg, worked out to deep square where it's whooshed back in
short of a length, slower ball, cut away to deep point and the strike's back with Uthappa
Walked down the crease, the ball just misses leg. Prior really should have had that one
worked to fine leg, Panesar makes a hash of it, but is quick to recover and chase
gone! Going for the two, Anderson did well to pick up the return from Bell and pick out the striker's end with a direct hit
unsurprising full ball, and they came back for two - it was risky but he made his ground fairly comfortably in the end

yorker, dug up there and Broad gets him with a piece of intelligent cricket - how did he keep his cool there? - by beating Zaheer in the sprint back to the non-striker's end and held the ball in his hands all the way
good shot that, down the track, expecting the full ball and helping it right round through a very fine leg
driven through mid-off and India win - terrific work from Uthappa and his inclusion has more than paid off
